Suite.SuiteDescription: Terms that every application should support

Parameter.ParameterDescription: specifies whether or not changes should be saved before closing
the file in which to save the object

Event.EventDescription: Return the number of elements of a particular class within an object
Event.DirectParamDescription: the object whose elements are to be counted

Parameter.ParameterDescription: the class of the elements to be counted

Event.EventDescription: Return the size in bytes of an object
Event.ReplyDescription: the size of the object in bytes
Event.DirectParamDescription: the object whose data size is to be returned

Event.ReplyDescription: true if it exists, false if not

Event.EventDescription: Get the data for an object
Event.DirectParamDescription: the object whose data is to be returned

Event.ReplyDescription: Object specifier for the new element

Parameter.ParameterDescription: the class of the new element
the location at which to insert the element
the initial data for the element
the initial values for the properties of the element

Event.DirectParamDescription: Objects to open. Can be a list of files or an object specifier.

Parameter.ParameterDescription: the file in which to save the object(s)
the file type of the document in which to save the data

Property.PropertyDescription: Various preferences that apply to the application as a whole
Has the document been modified since the last save?
the boundary rectangle for the window
Does the window have a close box?
Does the window have a title bar?

Enumerator.EnumeratorDescription: Ask the user whether to save

Suite.SuiteDescription: Useful events that aren't in standard suite

Event.EventDescription: Revert an object to the most recently saved version
Makes an object the 'focus' of AppleEvents

Parameter.ParameterDescription: reference to new focus of AppleEvents

Property.PropertyDescription: the refnum of the map in memory
the fork this document is editing (data fork or resource fork)
the resource map edited in this document
the file on disk corresponding to this resource map document

Class.ClassDescription: an editor document for a single resource

Property.PropertyDescription: the kind of the editor (gui, template, hexadecimal)
the resource edited by this document
the map document that owns this editor document

Class.ClassDescription: a GUI editor document for a resource

Property.PropertyDescription: all properties of the 'editor document' class

Class.ClassDescription: a template editor document for a resource

Property.PropertyDescription: all properties of the 'editor document' class

Class.ClassDescription: a hexadecimal editor document for a resource

Property.PropertyDescription: all properties of the 'editor document' class
the left pane of the hex window
the left pane of the hex window
the kind of data this pane displays (hexadecimal or ascii text)
the data displayed in this pane
the refnum of the map in memory
the fork this map is stored in (data fork or resource fork)
the global value of the map attributes (sum of the individual flags)
the size of the fork (in bytes)
the refnum of the map it belongs to
the (type,ID) pair (which can be useful to characterize this resource)
the refnum of the map it belongs to
the global value of the resource attributes (sum of the individual flags)
the size of the resource data (in bytes)
the size of the resource data (in bytes)

Class.ClassDescription: the result of a comparison between two maps

Property.PropertyDescription: resources which are only in the old map
resources which are only in the new map
resources which are in both maps and are different
resources which are in both maps and are identical

Class.ClassDescription: a record containing the type and the ID of a resource
